intro: Athamanta cretensis subf. pygmaea, commonly known as the Cretan dwarf bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and is known for its compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
